## High-level description
This is a `package.json` file for the "bl" (Buffer List) npm package. It defines the package's metadata, dependencies, and scripts for a Node.js module that provides functionality to collect buffers and access them with a standard readable Buffer interface, with streaming capabilities.

## Symbols

### Package Metadata
#### Description
Defines the basic information about the package.

| Name | Value | Description |
|:-----|:------|:------------|
| name | "bl" | The name of the package |
| version | "4.1.0" | The current version of the package |
| description | "Buffer List: collect buffers and access with a standard readable Buffer interface, streamable too!" | A brief description of the package's functionality |
| license | "MIT" | The license under which the package is distributed |
| main | "bl.js" | The main entry point of the package |

### Scripts
#### Description
Defines the npm scripts for linting and testing the package.

| Name | Command | Description |
|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| lint | "standard *.js test/*.js" | Runs the 'standard' linter on all JavaScript files in the root and test directories |
| test | "npm run lint && node test/test.js \| faucet" | Runs the lint script, then executes the test file and pipes the output through 'faucet' |

#### Description
Specifies the type and URL of the package's repository.

| Name | Value | Description |
|:-----|:------|:------------|

This `package.json` file provides essential information for npm to manage the "bl" package, including its dependencies, scripts for development and testing, and metadata for publication on the npm registry. The package appears to be focused on buffer and stream manipulation in Node.js environments.
